# US: Launching Your Campaign on Meta

What you need to get started with your Facebook and Instagram presence

Launching a new political campaign or organization can be both exciting and
challenging. Fortunately, there are a lot of robust offerings on our platforms
to help with your launch. We want to make sure that you have the information
you need to seamlessly get set up. Use the checklist below for an overview of
the basics for organic and advertising products so you can successfully launch
your campaign.

###  **Secure your profile**

Before you create your campaign or organization’s Page, make sure that your
profile is secure:

  *  **Privacy Checkup** will help you determine who can see what you share and who can find your profile on Facebook.
  *  **Security Checkup** will help you log out of unused apps and browsers, set up two-factor authentication and strengthen your password.
  *  _Two-Factor Authentication_ is a security feature that helps protect your Facebook account in addition to your password.

###  **Create your campaign Page**

A Page is a public presence designed for connecting with people at scale who
you may or may not know personally. We recommend people and organizations
involved in politics create a Facebook Page, rather than a profile. Your Page
is managed by profiles (such as your own profile, and that of employees at
your organization or on your campaign team) and will have access to tools such
as Page Insights and the ability to advertise. Be sure to add a profile
Picture or organizational logo, and a Cover Photo. Learn more about how to
create your Page here and how to request a verified badge here.

###  **Secure your Page**

The best way to secure your Page is to enroll the profiles that manage your
campaign Page in **Facebook Protect** **,** which offers candidates and all of
their staff a way to further secure their own accounts. By enrolling, we help
you (1) adopt stronger account security protections, like two-factor
authentication, and (2) monitor for potential hacking threats.

###  **Start posting to your Page**

There are many ways on Facebook to show what your campaign or organization
stands for. You can add your perspective on breaking news, solicit input from
your community, share a candid photo or Story to highlight your personality,
or even bring your followers along on your campaign with Live video. Keep in
mind that Facebook is where people connect with friends, family and
communities that matter to them. Authenticity is key—one of the best ways to
connect with supporters is to show them who you are and what you are about.
Learn more content best practices here.

###  **Understand our advertising requirements**

Once you’ve completed the important steps above, including securing your
accounts and setting up a Page, follow the below requirements if you decide to
run ads:

  * Ensure you have admin access to your campaign Page, either through your profile or through Business Manager (see below)
  * Set up a Business Manager, which will house all of your campaign’s assets and manage permissions. If you work with an agency, you’ll be able to create a partnership with their business.
  * If you’re running ads yourself, create an Ad Account in your Business Manager.
  * Ensure you have set up a payment method for your Ad Account.
  * Comply with our policies for ads about social issues, elections or politics:
    * Get individually authorized to run ads
      * This process may take up 2 weeks so make sure to get started early.
    *  _Create a disclaimer_ by going to the “Issue, Electoral or Political Ads”s tab in Page Settings
    * Link your disclaimer to your newly created Ad Account for your campaign
    * Assign a Page Owner. Once you create your disclaimer, you can use your disclaimer to indicate your Page Owner. You can also set your Page Owner to be your verified Business Manager, if your Business Manager is verified.
    *  _Note: you must complete all of these steps in order to run ads_
  * When you create your first ad, ensure that you select the “social issues, elections, or politics” special ad category in Ads Manager at the campaign level, before submitting your ad for review.

If you are partnering with an agency, we still encourage you to follow all the
steps above -- especially if you plan to ever _boost posts_ or run ads in
addition to your agency’s work. However, if your agency is handling all
advertising, you can allow them to set up the ad account. You can also assign
assets, including an Ad Account, within your Business Manager to your agency.

If you need any help when getting started with your campaign, you can review
_this checklist_ for running ads about social issues, elections, or politics;
and you can also reach out to our team.
